ygData.subject: RE: [EQCheats] ShowEQ?
ygData.msgSnippet: Ya go ahead & use it & get banned. We need less hackers in EQ. Battlestaff Fuzzietoe  44th Ranked Druid of Karana on Mithaniel Marr Master
ygData.messageBody:
Ya go ahead & use it & get banned. We need less hackers in EQ.
 
Battlestaff Fuzzietoe <Wolven Reverence>
44th Ranked Druid of Karana on Mithaniel Marr
Master Baker, Master Brewer, Master Potter, Master Smith
 
-----Original Message-----
From: Trevalien Stormchaser [mailto:trevalien@...]
Sent: Saturday, May 06, 2000 11:07 PM
To: EQCheats@egroups.com
Subject: [EQCheats] ShowEQ?

I was at a college recently and in the dorms one of the students was runing
a program called showEQ  it displayed lots of mob/zone info and gave you an
overhead view of the zone and a list of items on each mob...i have never
heard of this...has anyone else? it runs on linux...

Trevalien


----Original Message Follows----
From: Sprite1784@...
Reply-To: EQCheats@egroups.com
To: eqcheats@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [EQCheats] Digest Number 182
Date: Fri, 5 May 2000 12:46:16 EDT

> I've heard that you can hex edit the Tutorial.exe so that you can view
any
> zone in the game free of mobs.  I was just wondering how exactly you do
that.
>  What files to open with what, which lines of code to replace, etc. 
Thanks
> in advance.


There is an application out there you can use... if i find the link I will
send it on. Anyone else have it handy?
>>

Actually I found it about 10 minutes after I sent the mail (isn't that
always the way?)  Just FYI for the rest of you.. in HackersQuest's FAQ they
give you directions on how to modify the tutorial, and a link to a hex
editor that you need to do it.  Or, if you want to do it the easy way, they
also have a link for a program that does it all for you.  I suggest copying
the tutorial and renaming it so you can keep the original if you mess it up
somehow, tho if you're paying attention it really isn't tough to do.  Here's
the link:

http://www.hackersquest.gomp.ch/html/faq.shtml#2
